@graph.name: BEST Red Velvet Cupcake Recipe - The Cookie Rookie
@graph.description: This is the BEST Red Velvet Cupcake Recipe you will ever try. You haven't lived unless you've tried these classic Red Velvet Cupcakes with the most amazing cream cheese frosting! Classic, delicious, EASY and perfect. With the best Red Velvet Cupcakes in hand, you're ready for Christmas or Valentine's Day.

itemListElement.name: The Best Red Velvet Cupcakes Recipe

@graph.headline: The Best Red Velvet Cupcakes Recipe

@graph.name: Becky Hardin
@graph.description: Becky woke up on her 30th birthday and realized she didn't know how to cook, ANYTHING! She started The Cookie Rookie as a way to document her journey to learn how to cook, one recipe at a time! The Cookie Rookie is a place to find easy recipes that anyone can make, and everyone will love!

@graph.name: Best Red Velvet Cupcake Recipe
@graph.description: This is the BEST Red Velvet Cupcake Recipe you will ever try. You haven't lived unless you've tried these classic Red Velvet Cupcakes with the most amazing cream cheese frosting! Classic, delicious, EASY and perfect. With the best Red Velvet Cupcakes in hand, you're ready for Christmas or Valentine's Day.
recipeIngredient: The Best Icing Ever ((click for recipe))

recipeInstructions.text: *The flour/milk mixture for the icing needs time to cool completely in the fridge, so start the icing at least 1 hour before starting the cake. (see notes)
recipeInstructions.name: *The flour/milk mixture for the icing needs time to cool completely in the fridge, so start the icing at least 1 hour before starting the cake. (see notes)

recipeInstructions.text: Line 3 regular-size muffin pans with cupcake liners.
recipeInstructions.name: Line 3 regular-size muffin pans with cupcake liners.

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium bowl, place the cracked eggs and whisk until egg whites and yolks are blended.
recipeInstructions.name: In a medium bowl, place the cracked eggs and whisk until egg whites and yolks are blended.

recipeInstructions.text: Add remaining liquid ingredients and whisk until well incorporated. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Add remaining liquid ingredients and whisk until well incorporated. Set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: In the mixing bowl of an electric mixer, place all dry ingredients and mix until completely combined.
recipeInstructions.name: In the mixing bowl of an electric mixer, place all dry ingredients and mix until completely combined.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix on medium-high speed for 1 minute or until mixture is completely incorporated.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix on medium-high speed for 1 minute or until mixture is completely incorporated.

recipeInstructions.text: Fill batter 2/3rds up the prepared cupcake liners.
recipeInstructions.name: Fill batter 2/3rds up the prepared cupcake liners.

recipeInstructions.text: Gently tap the pans on the counter a few times to release any air bubbles from the batter.
recipeInstructions.name: Gently tap the pans on the counter a few times to release any air bubbles from the batter.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake 15-20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the middle of a middle cupcake comes out clean.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake 15-20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the middle of a middle cupcake comes out clean.

recipeInstructions.text: Let the cupcakes rest 10 minutes, then remove from pans and cool completely on a cooling rack.
recipeInstructions.name: Let the cupcakes rest 10 minutes, then remove from pans and cool completely on a cooling rack.

recipeInstructions.text: Optional:  If a cake is desired, this cake batter will make a three-layer 8-inch cake.
recipeInstructions.name: Optional:  If a cake is desired, this cake batter will make a three-layer 8-inch cake.

recipeInstructions.text: Find our favorite icing recipe HERE. Enjoy!
recipeInstructions.name: Find our favorite icing recipe HERE. Enjoy!
